{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy (HIE) is a type of brain damage that occurs when an infant's brain doesn't receive enough oxygen and blood. It is a serious birth complication that requires immediate medical intervention. One of the common symptoms of HIE is seizures. The other options do not specifically relate to HIE as it does not preferentially affect lower limbs more than upper limbs, proximal muscles more than distal muscles, or specifically involve the trunk.", "answer_choice": "C. Seizure"}
